alert.note: Alert for Emmet; Hancock; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Winnebago; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 01 at 2:35PM CST until February 02 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Bitter Cold Arrives Tonight and Wednesday Morning... .A strong cold front has moved across Iowa this afternoon and will continue to bring in Arctic air for the next several days. By Wednesday morning, actual air temperatures will be in the single digits across much of Iowa, with values below zero in far northern Iowa. North to northwesterly wind gusts of 20 to 25 MPH will continue overnight and into Wednesday morning. This combination will lead to bitter wind chills across northwestern Iowa on Wednesday morning. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north-central and northwest Iowa. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Emmet; Hancock; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Winnebago; Wright
